item.title: Is it worth stealing bases in 2023?
item.description: In the 2022 offseason, the MLB instituted rules that, among other changes, reduced the distance between bases by 4.5 inches. We can use run expectancy to gain the expected run gain on a steal. To do this, we used a joint run-expectancy matrix from the last 7 years.

item.title: Baseball isn't being played optimally (and it's good for the fans)
item.description: On April 10th, the Seattle Mariners lost to the Chicago Cubs in extras 2-3. After a scoreless inning for the Ms, the Cubs stole third and then sac-flied their way to a walk-off win at home. Despite being the result of only a single regular season game (and not even the craziest between the Mariners and Cubs, as the Ms would lose 9-14 the following day), this game can teach us a lot about scoring in baseball: specifically, that teams aren’t scoring optimally.
